intro: Tovomita guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese tovomita, is a tropical plant native to South America, particularly found in Guyana, Suriname, and French Guiana. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in humid, lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
